title: Lumbridge Swamp Caves

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Lumbridge Swamp Caves are a dungeon filled with a variety of monsters and Slayer monsters, located beneath Lumbridge Swamp.

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Lumbridge Swamp Caves
Lumbridge Swamp Caves
Released14 March 2005 (Update)
MembersYes
Floors1
LocationDorgesh-Kaan
InhabitantsWall beasts, Cave crawlers, Cave goblins, Cave slimes, Cave bugs, Rockslugs, Giant frogs, Big frogs
MusicCave of the Goblins
Map
Advanced data
Typedungeon

The Lumbridge Swamp Caves are a dungeon filled with a variety of monsters and Slayer monsters, located beneath Lumbridge Swamp.

There are three entrances to the caves:

  • From the swamp near the candle seller, requiring a rope.
  • Directly south from the Lumbridge castle cellar. You must start The Lost Tribe to gain access this way. A pickaxe is needed to enter for the first time.
  • From the minigame Tears of Guthix, which is its own cave branching off from the Lumbridge Swamp Caves.

The caves require a light source, unless the player has lit a fire of eternal light near the rope entrance. Minimum recommended items include a light source with tinderbox, rope, spiny helmet and antipoison.

Contents

  • 1 Monsters
  • 2 Features
  • 3 Hazards
  • 4 Quests
  • 5 Personalities
  • 6 Music

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Wall beast (level 49) - Level 35 Slayer required, spiny helmet needed for protection from attacks (there are holes in the wall where the beasts can attack you). If navigating around the caves, the Wall beasts can be avoided by stopping one square behind the holes in the wall and then running past them.
  • Cave crawler (level 23) - Level 10 Slayer required. These can poison you, so antipoison potions recommended.
  • Cave goblin (level 3) - These are goblins which live underground.
  • Cave slime (level 23) - Level 17 Slayer required. Poisonous walking blobs of slime.
  • Cave bug (level 6) - Level 7 Slayer required.
  • Rockslug (level 29) - Level 20 Slayer required, bags of salt needed to kill.
  • Giant frog (level 99) - The toughest monster in these caves, although they are non-aggressive.
  • Big frog (level 24) - Smaller and (much) weaker versions of giant frogs.

Features[edit | edit source]

  • You can net fish for giant frog spawn in these caves. You will need 33 Fishing to catch them.
  • A Dwarf multicannon can be used in the caves.

Hazards[edit | edit source]

A symbol indicating an area subject to gas explosions.
  • In the north-west and the south-middle sections of the cave, an open light source (such as a candle, torch or oil lamp) can ignite dangerous swamp gas, resulting in an explosion, dealing 12 damage and extinguishing the light source. You will need a tinderbox to relight it.
  • Upon falling through a trapdoor in the Dorgesh-Kaan mine, the player will wash up in a pool near the northern entrance, extinguishing the light source.
  • There are two stepping stone obstacles. Failing a stepping stone obstacle will extinguish the player's light source.
  • Wall beasts are located throughout the cave, often occupying narrow corridors. To avoid them, simply stop one square behind the hole in the wall and run past them.
A map showing various hazards in the caves.

Quests[edit | edit source]

  • Tears of Guthix quest and minigame
  • The Lost Tribe quest is involved (when you incorrectly navigate the maze, you can end up in the caves)
  • Another Slice of H.A.M. is loosely affiliated
  • Wanted whilst chasing Solus Dellagar
  • Death to the Dorgeshuun is involved (after a H.A.M. member catches you and Zanik listening to a secret meeting)

Personalities[edit | edit source]

  • Juna - the guardian to the Chasm of Tears

Music[edit | edit source]

  • Cave of the Goblins
  • The Lost Tribe
  • The Power of Tears
  • Tears of Guthix

The '''Lumbridge Swamp Caves''' are a [[List of dungeons|dungeon]] filled with a variety of [[monsters]] and [[Slayer monsters]], located beneath [[Lumbridge Swamp]].

There are three entrances to the caves:
*From the swamp near the [[candle seller]], requiring a [[rope]].
*Directly south from the Lumbridge castle cellar. You must start [[The Lost Tribe]] to gain access this way. A pickaxe is needed to enter for the first time.
*From the [[minigame]] [[Tears of Guthix (minigame)|Tears of Guthix]], which is its own cave branching off from the Lumbridge Swamp Caves.

The caves require a [[light source]], unless the player has lit a [[fire of eternal light]] near the rope entrance. Minimum recommended items include a light source with tinderbox, rope, [[spiny helmet]] and [[antipoison]].

==Monsters==
*[[Wall beast]] ''(level 49)'' - Level 35 [[Slayer]] required, [[spiny helmet]] needed for protection from attacks (there are holes in the wall where the beasts can attack you). If navigating around the caves, the Wall beasts can be avoided by stopping one square behind the holes in the wall and then running past them.
*[[Cave crawler]] ''(level 23)'' - Level 10 Slayer required. These can [[poison]] you, so [[antipoison]] potions recommended.
*[[Cave goblin (monster)|Cave goblin]] ''(level 3)'' - These are [[goblin]]s which live underground.
*[[Cave slime]] ''(level 23)'' - Level 17 Slayer required. Poisonous walking blobs of slime.
*[[Cave bug]] ''(level 6)'' - Level 7 Slayer required.
*[[Rockslug]] ''(level 29)'' - Level 20 Slayer required, [[Bag of salt|bags of salt]] needed to kill.
*[[Giant frog]] ''(level 99)'' - The toughest [[monster]] in these caves, although they are [[Tolerant|non-aggressive]].
*[[Big frog]] ''(level 24)'' - Smaller and (much) weaker versions of giant frogs.

==Features==
*You can [[Small fishing net|net fish]] for giant [[frog spawn]] in these caves. You will need 33 [[Fishing]] to catch them.
*A [[Dwarf multicannon]] can be used in the caves.

==Hazards==
[[File:Explosion symbol.png|thumb|A symbol indicating an area subject to gas explosions.]]
*In the north-west and the south-middle sections of the cave, an open [[light source]] (such as a [[candle]], [[torch]] or [[oil lamp]]) can ignite dangerous swamp gas, resulting in an explosion, dealing 12 damage and extinguishing the light source. You will need a [[tinderbox]] to relight it.
*Upon falling through a trapdoor in the [[Dorgesh-Kaan mine]], the player will wash up in a pool near the northern entrance, extinguishing the light source.
*There are two stepping stone obstacles. Failing a stepping stone obstacle will extinguish the player's light source.
*Wall beasts are located throughout the cave, often occupying narrow corridors. To avoid them, simply stop one square behind the hole in the wall and run past them.
[[File:Lumbridge swamp caves hazards.png|thumb|left|A map showing various hazards in the caves.]]
{{Clear}}

==Quests==
*[[Tears of Guthix]] [[quest]] and [[minigame]]
*[[The Lost Tribe]] quest is involved (when you incorrectly navigate the maze, you can end up in the caves)
*[[Another Slice of H.A.M.]] is loosely affiliated
*[[Wanted]] whilst chasing [[Solus Dellagar]]
*[[Death to the Dorgeshuun]] is involved (after a [[H.A.M. member]] catches you and [[Zanik]] listening to a secret meeting)

==Personalities==
*[[Juna]] - the guardian to the [[Chasm of Tears]]

==Music==
*[[Cave of the Goblins]]
*[[The Lost Tribe (music track)|The Lost Tribe]]
*[[The Power of Tears]]
*[[Tears of Guthix (music track)|Tears of Guthix]]
